intro: Seseli annuum subsp. carvifolium, commonly known as caraway-leaved seseli, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs such as parsley and dill. The plant is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves and small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels. It typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and woodland edges. The subspecies is distinguished by its distinctive leaf morphology, which resembles that of caraway plants.
